programme.title: The Kid
programme.desc: On the run in the American Southwest, a boy encounters the infamous outlaw Billy the Kid and the legendary lawman Pat Garrett. He soon finds himself caught in the crossfire as Billy and Garrett square off in a deadly game of cat and mouse.

programme.title: Billy the Kid
programme.desc: Billy the Kid works for kindly rancher Tunstall until he is murdered by a corrupt lawman and his cronies. A distraught Billy goes on a violent rampage through the New Mexico Territory, and is finally brought down by his old cohort, Pat Garrett.

programme.title: The Legend of the Lone Ranger
programme.desc: Masked Man (Klinton Spilsbury) and Tonto (Michael Horse) derail a criminal mastermind's (Christopher Lloyd) plot to hold President Grant and his train.

programme.title: Whistling Hills
programme.desc: A gunman is hired by stageline owner Chet Norman to stop a series of stagecoach holdups that always take place when the driver, Pete, sees a mystery rider and hears the weird notes of a silver whistle.

programme.title: Lawless Cowboys
programme.desc: A cowboy enlists the aid of an honest bronco buster and a local newspaperman to uncover a rodeo-fixing scheme.

programme.title: The Trail Beyond
programme.desc: Rod Drew (John Wayne) is asked to search for missing people in Canada, and quickly finds out a gang of French Canadian outlaws have been kidnapping people.

programme.title: West of the Divide
programme.desc: Ted and Dusty infiltrate a band of outlaws to get close to Mr. Gentry, the man who murdered Ted's father.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: A wanderer seeking his parents' lynchers, arrives in Virginia City as Ben and Adam are convicted of murder.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: Two British socialites find that they still have a lot to learn when they visit their friends, the Cartwrights.

programme.title: 26 Men
programme.desc: When two rangers arrive to help the newspaper editor of Wilcox, they find out he has been lynched and is hanging from a tree.

programme.title: 26 Men
programme.desc: Rynning hires an Apache tracker to find a gang of desperadoes committing murder and robbery across the entire Arizona Territory.

programme.title: 26 Men
programme.desc: A member of the notorious Wild Bunch bandit gang escapes from Ranger Clint Travis' custody, resulting in his being fired. Furious, Travis sets out to take on the whole gang.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Matt and Margaret investigate the kidnapping of banker Penrose from a stagecoach; they immediately suspect noted bandit Milt Sharp who recently escaped from a Nevada prison and his partner Dutch; a showdown takes place at the Penrose home.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Matt and Margaret investigate when a railroad payroll worth $25,000 is stolen.

programme.title: The Adventures of Jim Bowie
programme.desc: Jim steps in when the army tries to relocate the Seminole Indians from their lands.

programme.title: The Adventures of Jim Bowie
programme.desc: Jim is unwittingly dragged into a plot to assassinate President Jackson.

programme.title: The Adventures of Jim Bowie
programme.desc: Jim visits the Mexican state of Texas, hoping to buy land, but he's arrested as a spy and sentenced to death.

programme.title: The Adventures of Jim Bowie
programme.desc: After his rifle misfires during a close encounter with a bear, Jim approaches a blacksmith to suggest a different kind of knife.

programme.title: The Adventures of Jim Bowie
programme.desc: Jim persuades an imperious plantation owner to allow a squatter and his pregnant wife to remain on her land.

programme.title: The Adventures of Jim Bowie
programme.desc: Jim is amused when his friend is mistaken for the missing son of King Louis XVI and Marie Antoinette.

programme.title: The Adventures of Jim Bowie
programme.desc: Jim takes a turn as a volunteer deputy to guard a prisoner, but he begins to doubt the prisoner's guilt.

programme.title: The Adventures of Jim Bowie
programme.desc: Jim believes a fur company may be trying to drive him away by killing any Cajun trapper with whom he does business.

programme.title: The Adventures of Jim Bowie
programme.desc: A case of mistaken identity leads an angry farmer to decide that Jim must marry his daughter in a shotgun wedding.

programme.title: The Adventures of Jim Bowie
programme.desc: Jim is asked to protect a group of travelers from a bandit preying on people along the road to Natchez.

programme.title: The Adventures of Jim Bowie
programme.desc: Jim's family takes on the local saloonkeeper, who has different visions of the town's future.

programme.title: The Adventures of Jim Bowie
programme.desc: Jim assists farmers who are being forced to pay protection money to an old woman who threatens to unleash the ghost of a Louisiana pirate on them.

programme.title: Northern Patrol
programme.desc: Corporal Webb finds a man who seems to have hung himself after writing a suicide note. Webb notes this happened while the suicider was in the midst of cooking himself a meal, and concludes that all is not right in this part of Canada.

programme.title: Arizona Bound
programme.desc: The Rough Riders (Buck Jones, Tim McCoy, Raymond Hatton) team up to save a woman's stagecoach line from a Mesa City saloon gang.

programme.title: Angel and the Badman
programme.desc: A Quaker (Gail Russell) and her family reform a wounded outlaw (John Wayne) who has a killer on his trail.

programme.title: Shotgun Slade
programme.desc: A rancher whose foreman is murdered asks Slade for help.

programme.title: Shotgun Slade
programme.desc: Slade is attacked by escaped bank robbers looking for their partner who has hidden their loot.
